name: digdugz
text: What if you have two Ipods?

name: agika
text: You would be almost as good as a gay guy with one iPod.  Almost.  Unless your iPod was gay.

name: vreeeee
text: Man I ain't got an iPod. I guess that means I have no cultural cachet at all. Unless I'm gay.

name: tourach3
text: well it looks like you have about three years to wait until you find out

text: A comment left by numberkillinger was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Spoon, redion, TonyHighwind, TheGreatestCape)

name: scorpio_nadir
text: thank you.

name: jaldor
text: Talk about a machine that basically has AIDS.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Fact: All iPods are gay.

name: fablesandblues
text: It's science!

name: terribleman
text: There you go, man! Straight up saying science for the man on the go.

name: soticoto
text: No.

name: jonmw
text: You would still be soundly defeated by someone who was Double Gay.

name: skviiier
text: i.e. ... straight?

name: dusty
text: Double gay is what happens when someone raised by two dads turns gay both naturally and from his upbringing. The two dads sometimes have a hard time learning and accepting that their son is double gay.

name: overmedicated
text: Queeeeeeeeeeeer...

name: agika
text: That is probably how I will use MY dying breath.

name: dovey
text:
But you're not a king...

...are you?

name: duperando
text: ....King piss.

name: dusty
text: Considering that I'm a robotic engineer I'll probably use my dying breath like "the green wire's connected to the TX, the black wire is connected to the ground plug, the red wire's connected to the *BZZT* *POP* *ssssssssssssss*" and yes, I will be singing this to the tune of dem bones .

name: spinynorman
text:
Aaaaaarthur!

Extended vowels sing of feather boas, hand lotions, and sensible purchases of scented candles.

name: bozendoka
text:
Damn, you beat me to it!

By, like, a year. So, no contest, really.

name: picnick
text: nooooOOOO

name: breadcrab
text: ... Man, I have been wondering what Retardo has been saying all this time to get everyone to hate him, and now I'm just kinda disappointed. I hope you're happy :<

name: scraggg
text: Yeah, before I made this here account and just lurked, there was always such an air of mystery about them.

name: saint
text:
Jelouse? Is that a thing?

I had to latch on to some thing in that comment that didn't make my mind's eye angry with me. The English major in me rose to the surface and spared me the imagery.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
pronounced like 'jealousy'

'jealous-e'

name: epicurus
text: To me, the best part is the idea that that was a common curse at the time.

name: agika
text: I STILL use that curse, man.  Are you saying it's out of style nowadays?  I probably told, like, 20 people today that they would have homosexual offspring.

name: catachresis
text: Props for the coach driver's sideburns. That was totally how they were. I am English, I know these things.

name: dovey
text: Are you also nearly 700 years old?

name: mercuri0us
text: They are called "mutton chops"

name: soticoto
text:
And I used to have them myself... and a top hat.
Well, I have a top hat now, but my facial hair is more a fu manchu and goatee combo now. I look less victorian and more like the forbidden lovechild of Dick Dastardly and a stage magician.

name: anzio
text: Why?

name: william
text: Alt Text: What Ray means to say is that the media have turned queer sexuality into a commodity.

name: tekende
text: I really like this alt text. Like, a LOT. I think I'm queer for it.

name: johnnybaverage
text: Ray is often more astute than he lets on.

name: aperson
text: Gladdington Castle is an unrealistic name for a castle of the 14th century. I know this is lame, but nonetheless...

name: lastlarf
text:
While we're at it, Edward II died in 1327, succeeded by Edward III, who reigned for a good 50 years after that.

Though I guess it is never established that this is an English king, just a king who is in England.

Oh, also this is the King of English Cats, not of English people, so I don't even know why I'm bothering to post this. But I am.

name: dougthehead
text: The really funny thing about this is that Edward III, successor to Edward II, was gay.  Even funnier is that it's a Braveheart reference ("Longshanks" was Edward II, his feminine son was Edward III), and Ray doesn't even notice.

name: ninjaein
text: A Chubby for both you and lastlarf for not only knowing your history, but for making me realize that part in Braveheart.

name: jamb23
text:
Wow wow wow. Edward I was Longshanks. Edward II was his gay, pretty-bad-at-being-a-king son, and Edward III was his very hetrosexual son who started the 100 Years War.

Wait! I am...

A HISTORY NERD

name: ravigotte
text: I'm curious as to why noone has pointed out that the word "queer" is not by far as frequently used for homosexuality in Britain, as it is in the USA. Or am I wrong? (I'm from neither place).

name: dougthehead
text: Everything you wrote in the above post is correct.

name: terribleman
text: You are totally from history, dude.

name: wazza
text: Charles the Fair of France died in the right year...

name: latterman

text: I lamed. Repeating a blah joke will not make it funny.

name: tagrineth
text: Seconded, and a chubby for you sir.

name: latterman
text: Sorry guys, I was pretty out of it and forgot I had posted it already. I still deserve some lames.

name: scraggg
text: Your avatar makes me swat at my monitor every goddamn time.

text: That castle looks like it was screencapped out of a Super Nintendo game.

name: vreeeee
text: I'm sorry, Mario, but your sexuality is in another castle!

name: professorhazard
text:
Mario's sexuality is not in question.

HE
IS
A
HOMEBOY

name: cpnglxynchos
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: soticoto
text: . .. ... So what if a generation in their family does NOT have a son before the age of twenty-six?

name: epicurus
text: Maybe it transfers to adopted offspring or nephews or something. Not to mention any female children are carriers for the curse when they finally have a male descendant.

name: soticoto
text: Gotta love that X Chromosome.

name: ananke
text: I disagree.  The curse clearly states that it must be "sons of sons."

name: hrm
text: maybe having a son before the age of twenty-six is part of the curse.

name: laserblade
text: Well, it was fashionable for a while to pretend not to be gay.  Or maybe they donate sperm.

name: theirateturk
text: This curse is seriously lollin

name: old_crow
text: So THAAATS how it happens.

name: heccibiggs
text: Did the king know that his status would make the curse come true? Because if not, his dying words were basically the equivalent of "YOU PRIIIIIIIICK..!"

name: dybrar
text: Telling someone off as you are dying is raw as hell. That's one good night into which you are not going even remotely gentle.

name: jabroniville
text: I think I'm going to start using the King's final words in everyday conversation from now on. That's how perfect they are.

name: quartamilk
text: i like the cook's hat and that he wears eyeglasses in 1328

name: tekende
text: The phrase "hot raisin pudding" is absolutely disgusting. It sounds like a euphemism for diarrhea.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Well, when you forget and leave off the seasoning, that's basically what it is.

name: dusty
text: I get the feeling that Ray is one of those people who decides what he's going to say and from that point on doesn't really listen except to tell when you're done talking so he can say it.

name: greenkoolayd
text: my zune is being shipped here as i type this.... i wonder where that fits in this dealie...

name: zhankfor
text: Is it all... British magical realism?

name: terribleman
text: Kings need to be very careful. Even with the most common curses. Like if he says: Damn, I hate that prime minister. I hope he gets hit with a shovel, the guy might actually get hit in the head with a shovel!

name: terribleman
text:
For some reason, my inner ear surprised me with a very strange voice for Simon in the last panel. It was really dumb and raspy as hell, and I couldn't figure out where I had it from.
Coming back just now, the same thing happened, but now it becomes very clear to me that with his posture and undershot, thin musstache and glasses he is the spitting image of the Tourettes Guy (R.I.P. Danny). In my mind he's saying it like "Where's the paper towels??"
I am laughing so hard.
